Class: BasicChallengeHandler

BasicChallengeHandler

new BasicChallengeHandler()

Challenge handler for Basic authentication as defined in RFC 2617.

This BasicChallengeHandler can be instantiated using new BasicChallengeHandler(), and registered at a location using DispatchChallengeHandler.register(String, ChallengeHandler).

In addition, one can install general and realm-specific loginHandler functions onto this BasicChallengeHandler to assist in handling challenges associated with any or specific realms.

After instantiated a BasicChallengeHandler instance, the loginHandler function must be implemented to handle authentication challenge. By default, loginHandler will send an empty PasswordAuthentication.

The following example loads an instance of a BasicChallengeHandler, sets a login handler onto it and registers the basic handler at a URI location. In this way, all attempts to access that URI for which the server issues "Basic" challenges are handled by the registered BasicChallengeHandler .

var factory = new WebSocketFactory(); var basicHandler = new BasicChallengeHandler(); basicHandler.loginHandler = function(callback) { callback(new PasswordAuthentication("global", "credentials")); }; factory.setChallengeHandler(basicHandler);
Source:
  • WebSocket-debug.js, line 6187
See:
  • http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2616 RFC 2616 - HTTP 1.1
  • http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2617#section-2 RFC 2617 Section 2 - Basic Authentication

Methods

canHandle(challengeRequest) → {boolean}

Can the presented challenge be potentially handled by this challenge handler?
Parameters:
Name Type Description
challengeRequest a challenge request object containing a challenge
Source:
  • WebSocket-debug.js, line 6227
Returns:
true, if this challenge handler could potentially respond meaningfully to the challenge; otherwise false
Type
boolean

handle(challengeRequest, callback) → {void}

Handle the presented challenge by invoking the callback function with a challenge response processed appropriately.

By default, the implementation of this method invokes the callback function using a null challenge response and failing authentication.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
challengeRequest a challenge object
callback function that is called when the challenge request handling is completed.
Source:
  • WebSocket-debug.js, line 6246
Returns:
Type
void

loginHandler(callback) → {void}

handle authentication challenge loginHandler will be called when an authentication challenge is received from the server. To respond to the challenge, simply invoke the "callback" function with a PasswordAuthentication object as the argument, or invoke the "callback" function with null as the argument if no credentials have been returned.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
callback the function to be invoked when the credentials are retrieved. To invoke the callback function, use callback(new PasswordAuthentication(username, password)); to login or callback(null) to cancel
Source:
  • WebSocket-debug.js, line 6284
Returns:
Type
void

setRealmLoginHandler(realm, loginHandler) → {void}

Set a Login Handler to be used if and only if a challenge request has a realm parameter matching the provided realm.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
realm the realm upon which to apply the loginHandler.
loginHandler the login handler to use for the provided realm.
